cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: drifting north-northwest, then turning northwest toward the South Carolina coast before moving inland and eventually curving northeast along the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the central South Carolina coast between Charleston and Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from northern Florida through North Carolina, especially South Carolina coastline
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained 25–35 mph winds with higher gusts (up to 40 mph) as outer bands brush coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible, mainly during high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible from outer rainbands; heavier totals stay north in South Carolina.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents could disrupt pilot transfers and small craft operations near the harbor entrance.
